An eroding legal system

As the imprisonments of three student leaders who involved in Occupy Central, the rule of law of Hong Kong has faced an unprecedented crisis. The political motivation behind the sentences triggered an approximately 50,000 people march on last Sunday. Undoubtedly, the justice of the legal system of Hong Kong has been eroded from this political intervention.

In terms of the tightening political activities by the notorious Chinese government, the human right and the freedom of speech in Hong Kong are eclipsing. The edge of Hong Kong was reduced after the transfer of soverity from the United Kingdom to China. Some of the social activities were jailed because of their political activities while some of the HongKongers condemned their behaviors will harm the stable development of Hong Kong. Ironically, undergoing political activities are a form of social development while some of the HongKongers focus exclusively in economic development.

To protect the remaining freedom of Hong Kong, HongKongers must take actions to counterbalance the tightening control from the Chinese government. Despite the cost of political movement is too high, HongKongers need to bolster the right things till the last minute. Therefore, the justice of the political system and the human right can be survived under the control of the Chinese government.
